name: needleall
title: needleall
description: <text lang="en">Many-to-many pairwise alignments of two sequence sets</text> </description>

format.python: ("", " -datafile=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_datafile.comment: <text lang="en">This is the scoring matrix file used when comparing sequences. By default it is the file 'EBLOSUM62' (for proteins) or the file 'EDNAFULL' (for nucleic sequences). These files are found in the 'data' directory of the EMBOSS installation.</text> </comment>

e_gapopen.prompt: Gap opening penalty (Floating point number from 1.0 to 100.0)
e_gapopen.comment: <text lang="en">The gap open penalty is the score taken away when a gap is created. The best value depends on the choice of comparison matrix. The default value assumes you are using the EBLOSUM62 matrix for protein sequences, and the EDNAFULL matrix for nucleotide sequences.</text> </comment>

e_gapextend.prompt: Gap extension penalty (Floating point number from 0.0 to 10.0)
e_gapextend.comment: <text lang="en">The gap extension, penalty is added to the standard gap penalty for each base or residue in the gap. This is how long gaps are penalized. Usually you will expect a few long gaps rather than many short gaps, so the gap extension penalty should be lower than the gap penalty. An exception is where one or both sequences are single reads with possible sequencing errors in which case you would expect many single base gaps. You can get this result by setting the gap open penalty to zero (or very low) and using the gap extension penalty to control gap scoring.</text> </comment>

e_endopen.prompt: End gap opening penalty (Floating point number from 1.0 to 100.0)
e_endopen.comment: <text lang="en">The end gap open penalty is the score taken away when an end gap is created. The best value depends on the choice of comparison matrix. The default value assumes you are using the EBLOSUM62 matrix for protein sequences, and the EDNAFULL matrix for nucleotide sequences.</text> </comment>

e_endextend.prompt: End gap extension penalty (Floating point number from 0.0 to 10.0)
e_endextend.comment: <text lang="en">The end gap extension, penalty is added to the end gap penalty for each base or residue in the end gap.</text> </comment>

e_minscore.prompt: Minimum alignment score (Floating point number from -10.0 to 100.0)

format.python: ("", " -minscore=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_minscore.comment: <text lang="en">Minimum alignment score to report an alignment.</text> </comment>

e_outfile.prompt: Name of the output alignment file

format.python: ("", " -aformat=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_errorfile.comment: <text lang="en">Error file to be written to</text> </comment>

comment: <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}div > <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}p >MSAProbs is an open-source protein multiple sequence ailgnment algorithm, achieving the stastistically highest alignment accuracy on popular benchmarks: <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a href="http://www-bio3d-igbmc.u-strasbg.fr/balibase/">BALIBASE</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a>, <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a href="http://www.drive5.com/muscle/prefab.htm">PREFAB</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a>, <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a href="http://bioinformatics.vub.ac.be/databases/databases.html">SABMARK</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a>, <{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a href="http://www.compbio.dundee.ac.uk/Software/Oxbench/oxbench.html">OXBENCH</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}a>, compared to ClustalW, MAFFT, MUSCLE, ProbCons and Probalign.</{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}p> </{http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml}div> </comment>
